description:
SimpleX - the first messaging network operating without user identifiers of any kind - 100% private by design! iOS,
Android and desktop apps ðŸ“±!

Unlike any other existing messaging platform, SimpleX has no identifiers assigned to the users - it does not use phone
numbers (like Signal or WhatsApp), domain-based addresses (like email, XMPP or Matrix), usernames (like Telegram),
public keys or even random numbers (like all other messengers) to identify its users - we do not even know how many
people use SimpleX.
New in v6.4.8:
- Android, desktop: fix stuck message reception and other events after passphrase change (e.g., during desktop app initial start).
- iOS: reduce memory usage when sharing to SimpleX app.
The GitHub release build is independently reproduced by:

Commits:
- v6.4.7: ios 311
- readme: switch image links to bypass CORS/ORB (#6418)
- ci: free up disk space before executing reproducible script (#6441)
- ci/reproducible builds: pin Java version (#6447)
- tests: skip multicast discovery in Mac CI (#6458)
- ios: reduce memory used by iOS share extension (#6465)
- ci: build simplex-chat CLI deb package (#6474)
- ci: add cli deb and fix formatting to reproducible-builds (#6483)
- ci: execute reproducible script from tag (#6485)
- desktop: fix linking mobile and connecting after onboarding. Also fixes other cases when core controller changes in android/desktop. (#6489)
- core: 6.4.8.0
- ios: update core library
- ios: 6.4.8 (build 314)
- v6.4.8: android 328, desktop 125
